storyInfo: Rangers and several other Rhodes Island operators run into an incident during a field mission. Having lost their means of transportation for the return trip, the four operators begin a trek through the deserts of Sargon.

attributes.content: I'm back.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: No problems, I take it?
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Nothing of particular note within a thirty kilometer range. The area is safe for now.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Very good. Let me take a look at the map.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: We're on the right track. Keep north, and we should see a waypoint the locals called Trumhill before long.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: We'll have an opportunity to rest at its base. From there, we can start moving west, and we'll be at Phecon within two days.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Is Phecon our destination?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Of course not, but it's the most suitable transfer station. Phecon sees a lot of Columbian caravans, which we can follow one to reach Twinriver. There, we have a Rhodes Island branch office.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: If we can get to the branch office, we'll be able to secure ourselves some transportation. From there, the rest will be much easier.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Music to my ears! Can't wait to wrap up this on-foot odyssey. My shoe soles are worn straight flat.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: You ought to walk outside more. It's good for your health, and you won't need to keep worrying so much about your weight.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: What about the communicator? Any linkable signal nodes?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Still no good. The way I see it, we're not going to get any direct contact with the Rhodes Island landship until we reach Phecon.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Not unless we can get our hands on a more powerful transmitter...
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: You can forget about that. There's no other nomadic city to be found around here.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Quite. That's why I made sure to ask you to bring more than enough food and water. It's a tall order to find any supplies on the way to Phecon.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I do remember little settlements dotted around here and there, but after all these years, I could hardly say whether any of them are still where they used to be.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: So you're pretty familiar with this area, Mr. Rangers.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Hah-hah-hah... I might've been a tad more familiar in my sprightlier days. Truth is, I haven't been around these wastelands in a long, long time.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: You drew that map yourself, Mr. Rangers?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Indeed. Any good ranger can draw their own maps, though I never would've guessed this one would still be useful even now. The topography around here hasn't been marred by Catastrophes too badly, so we might count ourselves lucky.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I'm sorry for all the bother we've made for you.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Don't you worry about it. It's this old man's duty to look out for you young'uns.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I share the responsibility for this mess, anyway. We wouldn't be in such a tight spot now if I had made the proper preparations beforehand.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: What, the band of mysterious mercenaries that raided the warehouse and by rotten luck just happened to make off with our car?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Who's going to believe a story like that? ?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I think it was the trader, actually. Pulled our car apart to sell off the parts, then fed us some random explanation to cover up after the fact.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I actually agree with you, for once.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: You didn't need the 'for once'.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The old me wouldn't have let him off as kindly as that, if we were going by our old Blacksteel mercenary customs.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: But you are Rhodes Island operators now. I'd much rather not see you get into fights with the locals.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: The medical supplies made it safely, and the trader didn't try to cook the books when paying us. We can't really ask for too much more.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Carrying a sack of refined Originium Ingots across the barrenlands by foot is incredibly dangerous.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: I won't deny how... perforated their explanations were. We can't count on the local Vouivre mercenaries to be totally honest with us, so I'll keep an eye out for that next time.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: But in the meantime, once we get back, you do have to report the property loss to Logistics.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Yeah, this is just how Vouivre is.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: That said...
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I could likely find our way there even without any maps or Arts, but we'd be taking time we don't have. I worry we're too many for that, and our water and food wouldn't last us.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: You can navigate the Sargon barrens without any tools? May I ask how?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: If we ever have the time in future, I can teach you a thing or two. It's all nothing more than my experience.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: How do I put it...
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: You're very worthy of the 'Ranger of the Red Valley' title, if I do say so.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Hah-hah-hah-hah. So you youngsters know how to tell an old tale or two as well, then.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: That's just an exaggerated title.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Aren't those tales all true, though? Like how you rounded up and brought all of the Jenkins Seven to justice in a single day, or how you held off an entire column of Rusthammer Bandits all by yourself...
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: How you struck ten targets with just a single arrow, or how you shot down a Lateranan's bullets while high up in the sky...
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: My word. So this is what the stories are like now.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: My Sargon colleagues at Blacksteel spoke of your tales from time to time, Mr. Rangers. They're all like this, pretty much. Stories not out of place in a theater.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: They wouldn't be out of place in a novel either.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: You've heard them too, right, Miss Schwarz?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: There was a mercenary traveling the breadth of Columbia who told me about one or two of them.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: I believe they were 'The Scimitar of the Bloody Valley' and 'Tragedy of the Lord Ameer'.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Mm... A little exaggerated indeed.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Rangers aren't as all-powerful as they've been portrayed.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I can't suppose to know what you've all heard, but I can say that the most widespread stories are largely untrue.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Rangers were not a fighting force. If you want my description, they were more akin to survivors banded together out in the wild.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: They started as just a couple of ordinary folk fallen into times of pain and strife. They stepped forth against the odds, against it all. They protected villages against the scourges that would pillage them.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: They weren't trained warriors, any of them. They were a resistance, born in a time of war that knew no other way, of devastation that took and took and took.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: They brimmed with anger under it. They refused to keel to cruel destiny through the months and years of the war.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Afterwards, as more and more joined them, they slowly grew from a lone autonomous militia of sorts to a collective of regional organizations, and so they resided across the wastelands, defending settlements while offering medical aid.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: I've read of that from my time at Blacksteel. From reports of the Sargon region, it wasn't just officials, but the rangers as well who'd pursue wasteland hooligans and mercenary looters to exhaustion, out across the wastelands.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: What those reports refer to is truth, I can say that.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Back then, a group of rangers certainly... had its heroes, and they certainly caught themselves a fair share of villains. The events you describe happened, but I stress that that wasn't standard fare.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: The vast majority of the time, we rangers simply helped towns fix their wells, fend off wild beasts, gather medicine, that kind of stuff. Just the little things.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Moreover, this area wasn't even Sargon territory back then...
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: So, Mr. Rangers, back then, you must've been part of that group of 'heroes,' right?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Hah-hah-hah. This old man is hardly so prestigious. I was but a normal scout and nothing more.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: ...Normal...?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: In the end, this organization of rangers ended up disbanding, didn't it?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: That certainly is a long story...
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Many things happened afterwards, to say the least. And once the war concluded, the Lord Ameers were settled, each with all the land they wanted.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Those Lord Ameers of Sargon would not tolerate an organization that bowed to no-one, and the rangers were one such organization.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Of course, opinion from the Lord Ameers aside, there were many reasons why the rangers disbanded. But these are past events, and it's been a very, very long time since. The nitty-gritty of it all has fallen out of this old man's head.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: So all those wild stories never actually happened?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The truth is often mundane. So you remedy it by exaggerating how things happened, and you make the story dramatic.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: And only when it's dramatic enough do people pass it down.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Your stories all picked up layers upon layers of artistry before they reached you.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Alright, this old man's told plenty enough himself. Let's get ourselves ready to leave.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: By the sound of things, we've already reached Sargon territory?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: We were already in Sargon as of last night. Can you please pay a little attention? When suddenly you're in trouble, I'll be the last one to help you.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I love how much you suck.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The land we step on now is the jurisdiction of the Lord Ameer of Bayalir, though his provisional capital is still a ways away.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: After that...
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Hold! Stop moving!
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: ...You heard that too.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: All of you, stay still. Something's approaching.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: ...It's close...
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: It's underneath us! Scatter!
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Franka! Move!
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: (Roars)
attributes.name: Hideous Monstrosity

attributes.content: What... what are these?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Are these... sand beasts?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Since when do sand beasts grow like this?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: One, two... no, there's just too many.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Move into formation! Be ready for battle!
attributes.name: Rangers
